definition[0]: relating to treating or testing people who are sick
note[0]: clinical medicine/experience/training etc (=medicine etc that deals directly with people, rather than with research or ideas)
example[0]: The drug has undergone extensive clinical trials  (=tests to see if it is effective in treating people).
example[1]: The therapy has helped people with clinical depression  (=a strong feeling of sadness, for which you need medical help).
definition[1]: relating to a hospital or clinic
example[2]: The program gives the students experience in a clinical setting.
definition[2]: considering only the facts and not influenced by personal feelings
example[3]: A formal marriage agreement sounds clinical, but it can be a good idea.
definition[3]: a clinical building or room is very plain and clean, but not attractive or comfortable
example[4]: The walls were painted a clinical white.
